TopicTitle: You May Be Full of Grief and Coffee, But I'm Full of Boredom and CapriSun

Articles.Content:
I grabbed a notepad and wrote down a space program. Not a plan, but the only thing that keeps KSP interesting for me. What I do is I build a minimalist launch craft and send something to orbit, while writing down the cost and keeping it within budget. Nothing else I do other than that is fun anymore. I've two saves, one where I don't care what I do, kill kerbals, destroy the world, etcetera

etcetera, and another where I have a permadeath type thing where I follow a strict budget (I'd link if I could find it).

Unfortunately I've never gone farther that a hyperbolic orbit around Laythe. Or any closer than a couple million meters of separation with an Eve intercept. I wish I could go to Eeloo, and I've always tried, but I've found that getting into orbit was a drag. Or an atmospheric drag I should say. I've built all of my rockets to be aerodynamic, in the hopes that KSP will one day have a realistic aerodynamics system (no, I don't Ferrams(?) Aerospace Research). Until then, very few of my rockets on my non-permadeath save are small. In fact, I don't think any of them are. It's always "build up" or "build out" but never "build small."

I suck at KSP.

And CapriSun is awesome. Don't judge me.

If you haven't tried it yet, Mission Controller is a great way to do a space program. It keeps track of your budget and gives you missions to complete in sequence.

As far as reaching the planets goes, keep practicing! You'll get there eventually!
